alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 01 at 12:48PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and runoff is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Arizona, including the following county, Gila. * WHEN...Until 330 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1245 PM MST, gauge reports indicated that water levels upstream and downstream of Elgo Dam were receding but still remained elevated. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Carlos. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
